title: Fruit and Nut Trees in Portland, Oregon
name: Fruit and Nut Trees in Portland, Oregon
description:
A Map by Arifilahi

This is a map of edible fruit and nut trees in the public rights-of-way in Portland, Oregon

properties.name: Apple Tree, easy access
properties.description: Posted by Jason   nw 24th & northrup, portland, orA parking strip variety, tart looking, very green, but near the fig tree on pettygrove. Bring some brie from food front, hit up the the fruit trees and park it at the park for some summer snacks.

properties.name: Apple tree near Trader Joes on 39th
properties.description: Posted by Netphemera   This fruit tree looks like an apple tree, although it might be pears. They\'re mostly green now with some spots of red. I haven\'t tried \'em yet, but it looks like they\'ll be ripe in late August. Right next to the parking lot, it looks like a lot of easy picking fruit.

properties.name: Cherry-size plums
properties.description: Posted by IdeathBoth yellow and red, both sides of the street, by the church. The trees get heavily burdened, and the sidewalk fills with them. Ripen in late June.

properties.name: Fig tree overhanging sidewalk
properties.description: Posted by Netphemera   Fig tree overhanging sidewalkThis looks like a very promising fig tree on the North Side of Belmont, just down the street from Paradox. I picked a fig but it wasn\'t ripe yet. I don\'t know when they\'ll ripen or how good they will be.

properties.name: Free Pear Tree in the parking strip
properties.description: Posted by Jason   Not tremendously fruity, this pear tree did have a few well developed pieces in jumping reach.

properties.name: Fruit Trees at Mt. Tabor Heights Church
properties.description: Posted by Netphemera   There seems to be two fruit trees near the parking lot of Tabor Heights United Methodist Church. I think one is an apple. I guess the other might be a pear tree.

properties.name: Fruit tree, possibly apple
properties.description: Posted by Netphemera   Fruit tree, most likely apple. It\'s right by Morrison so there are a lot of car exhausts, but it\'s hard to say if there is any residual sulfur or lead in the soil.

properties.name: Giant Mature Fig Tree over sidewalk
properties.description: Posted by Jason   nw 24th & pettygrove, portland, orjust getting ripe now, and the second seasonal batch is on its way too. Stroll to the park with some of these figs and enjoy the summer softball leagues.

properties.name: Plentiful and delicious blue plums
properties.description: Posted by IdeathOverhanging alley on East side, just north of Beech. Ripen in August.

properties.name: Possible very large apple tree
properties.description: Posted by Netphemera   This location has been reported as a very large apple tree. "there is a massively bearing apple tree of 42nd and alder i believe. on the north side of the street. don\'t go to the ones on the south side of the street." I will update when I confirm this info.

properties.name: Two tall cherry trees
properties.description: Posted by IdeathOn sidewalk; ripe in June/early July. Need to be climbed to harvest. Outside apartments, have never been harassed.

properties.name: Walnut (English)
properties.description: Posted by Arifilahi  5606 NE 16th Ave Portland Oregonharvest in the fall

properties.name: cherry tree
properties.description: Posted by Jason  ne davis and 20th, portland, ornot a lot of fruit withing reach, but a very fruitful tree.

properties.name: twin pear trees hanging over sidewalk
properties.description: Posted by Jason   se 58th just south of division st, portland, orlook like they\'ll be ripe early to mid august, or later. the house has plenty of fruit, so it\'s unknown their real willingness to share, but many many of there are hanging over the sidewalk, and are technicaly fair game.
